headline: Easy Roasted Red Pepper Hummus
description: This roasted red pepper hummus is easy to make in a food processor. It's flavored with garlic, lemon, tahini, and basil for a delicious vegan dip.
name: Easy Roasted Red Pepper Hummus

recipeInstructions.text: Combine chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, and garlic in the bowl of a food processor; pulse until blended. Add roasted peppers and basil; process until the peppers are finely chopped. Season with salt and pepper.
Transfer hummus to a small bowl, cover, and chill until ready to serve.

review.reviewBody: Perfect blend. I roasted the bell pepper on the gas range and that made a difference to the flavor. Fresh lemon and garlic.... this is a keeper. Will make this a lot.

This was an easy recipe to make, however, I'm not quite thrilled with the taste. I always follow a recipe the first time and feel there was too much of a garlic and lemon taste. I will make it again, though will definitely alter the amounts of garlic and lemon.

Very good. Really enjoy this recipe. Did add some EVOO to smooth texture out a bit. Not sure why all hummus recipes I've come across don't have olive oil as being one of the ingredients. Always have used it when making hummus; the mixture is less lumpy and not so pasty-tasting. Just our preference.
Excellent recipe
Absolutely love this recipe!!!
Absolutely love this recipe!!!
have never made it before, but it's sooo easy!! will be making over and over and will try other flavors
Delicious!

I am giving this 4 stars because it was a bit dry, to begin with, and I added just a drizzle of oil to smooth it out. The flavor is great and I added just enough salt. The thing about this stuff is it really needs to sit and let the flavors blend for a while to come together.

This recipe was a good foundation for hummus; however, I recommend adding only 1-2 teaspoons of lemon juice instead of a third of a cup. Otherwise, the lemon taste is very overpowering and sour. 

Also, you might add some cumin for more flavor.
I made it exactly as listed and it was great!

Very good. If you find the end result a bit thick just add some water while the processor is running until you get your desired consistency. You could also add a couple of roasted jalepeño peppers to the mix for some spice if you like that sort of thing.

I had to leave out the garlic due to an allergy and thin k it came out a bit too thick because all I had was crystallized lemon instead of lemon juice. But beside that my kids loved it! I even roasted my own red peppers.
Very easy to make! Fantastic recipe. Made it exactly as written. Will definitely make again.

We made a few changes, but stuck to the core recipe.

5 cloves garlic (this is a garlic-loving house!)
Fresh basil (~6 leaves), since we had some on hand
3/4 c. roasted red pepper
1/4 c. lemon juice
1/8 c. water (wanted the zing of the lemon juice, but not as much; used water to reach the right consistency)

Roasted Red pepper hummus. This is a very easy recipe. The hardest part was peeling the roasted bell peppers. The recipe did not include a portion of plain yogurt or plain sour cream or anything like that to make it even more creamy. It needs the sour cream or the yogurt to bring a little tang and extra creaminess to the hummus. Suggest adding equal parts yogurt to tahini to the blender while making at start. Add more to taste. Also added a quarter cup of extra virgin olive oil. For that reason, you give a four star.
Way too much lemon juice! Too sour.
Made according to recipe. Too much tahini. I feel like something is missing but not sure what it is.

We made it exactly as written, except we added just a pinch of red cayenne pepper to add a little bit of a kick to it and it was an outstanding combination of all of the ingredients for a 5-star master chef flavor that'll knock your socks right off!
I followed the changes that another reviewer made - using 2 tablespooons of minced garlic and substituting a few tablespoons of olive oil instead of tahini. It definitely turned out yummy!
I made my own tahini using a recipe on this site. Much better than any store bought!
I cut the lemon juice back, because I didn't want too much lemon flavor. I went for about 2 Tablespoons. Very good flavor. I let it set for a day in the fridge before enjoying!
I make hummus all the time- decided to try a new recipe with the red pepper- it came out way too thin- i even added a second can of chick peas and its still too runny ??

As written this was incredibly bland and not appetizing. I ended up adding more lemon juice and roasted red pepper and then adding a bunch of seasonings from other recipes online to fix it. I added half of a jalapeño, garlic, toasted onion powder, roasted garlic powder, chipotle powder, smoked paprika, black pepper, salt, cayenne, cumin, and some olive oil. I wasn't measuring, just sprinkling in small amounts of the seasonings until there was more flavor and kick. I took this to an event and people raved over it and kept asking for the recipe! (Fun tip: it sounds bizarre, but if you find yourself with overly runny hummus- say your tahini is too thin or you've added extra lemon juice- a little bit of potato flakes added to the mixture doesn't change the flavor and allows you to thicken it to your desired texture.)

Made this last night. Super easy! My husband is gobbling it up with baby carrots. I like the flavor okay, although the lemon is a bit too strong for my taste, and the hummus a tad too moist. I think next time I will only do a 1/4 cup lemon juice. But otherwise, really great!
Easy. Few ingredients. LOVE IT!

I had to add 2 tbsp of olive oil because my tahini separated, added a pinch of ground cumin and no salt. I also cut down on lemon.This hummus recipe is better than store bought plus it is quick and easy to make. Loved it.
I made my own tahini and found this recipe called for WAY too much garlic. That's all I can taste. I'll make it with 1/2 a clove next time. Great otherwise.
This was the best!! I even roasted my own red peppers and make my own tahini
This was delicious! I added a bit of nice Olive Oil at the end to help make it smoother along with some salt and pepper to boost flavor. Love this recipe!
I followed the recipe and it turned out great!
Very good !
This was much better after I added a couple more seasonings. It certainly was easy to make!
So good! Changes I made were using cooked dry organic chick peas (added enough water so it would move in my blender) and a half of a hot pepper - just because! I will make this a lot!

Easy to make.....Didn't have roasted peppers, but had some pickled red peppers...It was hotter than it probably would have been with roasted peppers...but all and all it is delicious...

When you make it for the first time I would have preferred to have the salt amount....I put in a 1/2 tsp and about 1/8 tsp of pepper....that worked but will adjust for the next time.

A nice basic recipe but too bland for me. I think it needs spice. I will say that it needs to set in the refrigerator a day for the flavors to develop but still it was bland. I would add some chili pepper or cayenne or something, not sure.
little too dry. Too much tahini. Added little more olive oil

This was wonderful, and it made more than I could eat at one sitting. I made 2 mistakes, though. (1) I included 1/2 of the liquid from my canned beans, which made it kind of watery (so don't do that, lol); and (2) I didn't include enough roasted red peppers; next time, I'll definitely add more. I gave the recipe a "5" because any flaws in it were of my own making and not the fault of the recipe. I ate it for lunch with pita chips but tonight I'm going to use it as the "topper" for my baked potato. Yum!
I ended up having to double the recipe to cut the lemon taste. When I make in the future I will half the lemon juice.

This was pretty good. I made it in my Blendtec blender. We ate it right away. It needed salt and maybe some olive oil. It was a little garlicky for my taste and doesn't necessarily need the basil. There is a little bit left over. I will see how it tastes tomorrow.

This is probably the best hummus recipe I have made yet. I live in small town, so roasted red peppers were not available, so I simply chopped up regular red peppers and added those. Turned out very tasty.

This recipe makes the best hummus I've ever eaten. I no longer buy hummus unless I do not have ingredients which is when I'm on a trip away from home for days. I've used this recipe minus the red peppers (which I roast at home, so easy) but I also use home roasted garlic when I have the time.

This was a very good recipe. I didn't have garbanzo beans so I just used chickpeas. I roasted the garlic as well which gave it an even better flavour. I entered my hummus at our local country fair and it came in 2nd place. But I think it was #1
I followed the recipe with some minor variations, i.e. I roasted the garlic as well and replaced half of tahini with some olive oil. I think this recipe is a keeper.

Did not like this. It was sour from all the lemon juice, and super bitter from the tahini. Also, no olive oil? No salt? Will not be making this again. I had to process another can of garbanzos, another clove of garlic, and another half cup of peppers into this.
It was pretty good. A bit too much lemon though.

My family and I really enjoyed this recipe. My picky 4 year old even asked if she could have some for breakfast! It's very easy to make and you could even leave out the peppers and add other flavors. I will definitely be making this again.

Five stars for the peppers and the easiness of the recipe! Basil just doesn't seem right for hummus (and I'm not sure 1/4 tsp. would even be noticed). I used a scant tsp. of cumin and I think it worked better with the tahini. A good drizzle of excellent olive oil and the lemon juice make more sense. That being said, I'm sure that there are as many hummus recipes as there are cooks who make it, all of us tweaking it to our tastes once we are familiar with the method and the tradition.
Way too much lemon juice.

I thought the recipe was good and had my friend try it before i jazzed it up. My friend thought the original version was bland. I added some sea salt, cumin, and crushed red pepper flakes taste. I had him try it again, and he loved it.

I made this today for the second time.for Clean Monday, which is the first day of Lent in Greece. I followed the recipe practically as written - the only changes I made were to add some spices (cumin, cayenne powder) as I wanted it a little spicier, and omitted the dried basil, which I find tasteless. I also included the juice from my home-cooked garbanzos, having taken note of reviews saying it was too thick. The result was tasty, but mine turned out a little soupy, probably because my tahini was more runny than my usual brand. I really like the sweetness added by the roasted red peppers, as tahini can be a little bitter. Overall, a very good recipe that I will continue to make.
add most of juice from can,,splash of oil, paprika & cayenne on top
When I made this the only thing I did different was add a little cayenne pepper. It was so much better than store bought.
Very nice but needs more kick. Add some cayenne pepper.
I actually used Sunbutter instead of tahini and it turned out great.

Super yummy, plus a little something different for the regular hummus fans. Also, fun side note, if you ever forget about the tahini in your fridge and it goes bad, peanut butter can be used as a substitute.
I used a HUGE clove of garlic which was a bit much but it was still delicious=)

With a few changes this recipe was great. I added more garlic, some olive oil, a couple dashes of smoked paprika, and a touch of sesame oil. The smooth consistency I like in my hummus was achieved with the olive oil. If grainy is your thing then leave it out.
It was quick and easy to make in my Ninja Blender. Doubled the recipe and kids loved it.
This was very good and easy to make. I followed the recipe exactly. I did make my own tahini though - not hard at all.
Added extra ground black pepper and salt to taste, cummin (approx. 1/4 tsp), crushed red pepper flakes (approx. 1/2 tsp), and juice from 1 lime.

The raw garlic was too overwhelming. Next time I will try garlic salt. I added some EVO too change the consistency as I found it too grainy. I added a bit more roasted peppers and 1/2 teaspoon each of cumin and cayenne.
I substituted 1/3 c olive oil &1 tbsp cumin for the tahini and added another can of beans. Turned out great!
This recipe has way too much lemon juice and tahini in it! Be sure to taste as you go before it's too late..
This is my go-to hummus recipe and I make this often. My only change is to leave out the basil. It is fantastic with pretzel crisps or veggies.

This was a good base. Four stars because it was fabulous with a few changes. 

used 1/4c tahini
1/4c lemon juice
1 whole head of roasted garlic instead of the raw cloves
1 roasted red pepper
1 roasted pablano pepper (because we like a little heat)
and then drizzled olive oil thru the chute until the consistency was as we liked it. It was very dry without the oil probably because I cut down on the tahini and lemon juice. I did "peel" the chickpeas.

I did use salt and pepper for some added interest. when my 14 yo boy tasted it he asked "is that all you made?" LOL! 

Anyway start with this recipe, it is solid and then adjust as you wish.

I really liked the recipe, but will definitely cut the lemon juice down a lot next time. It has a lemony aftertaste that I could do without. I doubled the recipe and peeled the garbanzo beans [same as chick peas]. I added more basil and more red peppers.

I usually make hummus on the fly without a recipe and it turns out differently every time, so I thought I would search for a good recipe. This one got so many great reviews and I was excited to try it. Not sure what happened with mine, but I did not like this at all. WAY too much lemon juice (and I even put in less than the 1/3 of a cup).......tasted like raw garlic....and needed salt! I didn't eat the first batch. Tried it again with sauteed garlic, the juice from 1 lemon (about 2 Tblsp), and a pinch of salt. So much better. But I can't give a recipe more than 1 or 2 stars if I had to make major changes to it.
I made it exactly as written, and it was good. Next time I will cut the lemon juice to 2Tbsp.
Great recipe. I roasted my own red peppers (2 of them) and used them. (@425; rotating so all sides are roasted and skin is peeling and browned)

Just made this recipe. Overall it is very yummy. Only thing I didn't like is the more coarse texture; I like hummus a bit smoother. Next time I am going to try to add a few Tbsp of olive oil to see if that helps and and also add salt and pepper prior to blending to ensure even flavor. Overall, good easy recipe!
This seemed to have to much liquid. It's an alright recipe,nothing to write home about.

I couldn't find tahini at my store and maybe it would have had a 5 star review with it, but as it is, I had to sub the tahini with 1 TBSP peanut butter and 1/4 c. sesame oil; I reduced the lemon juice as per other reviews and the end product was good. I come short of saying "Great" but if I could find the tahini it might be that. Thank for for the recipe.
I am totally addicted! Everyone who tries it loves it. I like spicy food, so I added 1/2 tsp of Sriracha sauce and it's to die for now!
Very easy and delicious! I used 3 garlic cloves, 1 cup of peppers, and added a couple tablespoons of EVOO. Thank you!

I was not a big fan of this. I did not use the freshest ingredients, (canned roasted red peppers and bottled lemon juice)but I still thought the lemon juice was too strong, the texture grainy and the garlic flavor disappeared.. I would tweak the recipe next time with less lemon juice, and fresh roasted red peppers to help with the texture..

I made this for a Christmas party and it was yummy! I did cut back on the tahini to 1/4 cup as it's not one my favorite flavors, but you do need it. Used one whole red pepper I roasted in the oven and fresh lemon juice. Upped the dried basil to 1/2 tsp and added 1/4 tsp salt. DELISH!! You could also do this with cannellini beans or whatever bean you prefer! Very good recipe and very healthy! Thank you Marbalet!

Roasted red pepper hummus is the only kind I like. This is my first time making my own. I always buy store bought. This was just as good! Next time I'll probably add one or two more cloves of garlic. I don't have a food processor, so I used my blender. It has one of those things that you can use to mash and stir things around as you blend.

I've made this recipe for a cocktail party and the guests raved about it. The only change I made was I used fresh basil since I have an abundance in the garden. I never knew hummus was so easy to make! I never have to buy it in the store again!

This is a good recipe. I think the amount of lemon is good - not too much, not too little. I like garlic, so I added a bit more. I roasted my pepper on the grill, so there wasn't any added liquid from the pepper that you would get from peppers from a jar. It seemed a bit thick, so I just added a little water to get the right consistency. Good flavor!

This is a wonderful recipe but rather than using tahini, I grated 1 cup Havarti cheese and added 1/4 teas cayenne pepper..I'm sure most fans would love the original recipe, but I like things somewhat spicy!
This is good for a base recipe.. but needs more spice. I added cumin, coriander, cayenne, and a bit of chilli powder. Delicious!

Delicious! Next time around I will cut down a little on the lemon juice, it came through a little too strong for my taste. Overall this is a wonderful, easy hummus recipe and all of my roommates loved it!
This is a nice recipe. I made one batch with the original instructions - yummy. Second batch, I roasted the garlic - yummy! Thanks for sharing - we love all hummus!
my 7-year-old loves it! easy-ish and delicious!

Cooking my own garbanzo beans definitely punched up the flavor. I just soak dried beans for 8 hours )or up to 24 hours), and cook them with lots of herbs - basil, bay leaf, garlic - to make things a bit more interesting. Having fresh lemon juice makes a big difference as well.

This was very delicious!!!! Wow~~ my first hummus turned out great! Thank you for the recipe!

I did reduced the amount of Tahini like the other viewer recommended, and I added hand full of left over dry roasted pine nuts I had in the fridge. The color is absolutely beautiful and taste is stunning! With all these beans, nuts and seeds with garlic and lemon? I feel healthier already!!!
tahini makes it taste like peanut butter
A good way to use roasted red peppers, olives, basil, cumin. Easy on the red pepper. Add salt.

Fantastic! I just finished making this and tasted it. Roasted my own red pepper (used 1 whole one) and followed the recipe pretty closely except I added a dash of salt and used half the lemon. This couldn't be an easier recipe and it is SOOOO much better than store bought! For those who said it was missing something, it's probably all those chemicals in the store bought we are all used to eating. :) Will make this again and again, also trying other flavors. It was great even before I added the red pepper. Thanks Marbalet! Highly recommended.
This was is a wonderful tasting hummus! I have made this several times and everyone who enjoys hummus has absolutely loved this when I have made it.

I couldn't find tahini at the store I went to, and didn't feel like making another stop. Other reviewers said they left it out and it was fine, so I did as well. Likely because of omitting the tahini, it was a little on the runny side, but it still tasted really good and had a decent texture. Next time I will plan ahead and look for tahini to see if it makes a difference.
Just likr Sabra, Added cayenne pepper,
So yummy! I added a little smoked paprika and cumin for an extra smoky smokey kick. The first batch was gone within 30 minutes of the party! Thanks for the great recipe.

Easy, beautiful, and delicious. I used bottled lemon juice ( that's what I had around) and added a little olive oil to make it process through my blender a little easier. Don't forget to add a little salt, it makes a big difference.
I used a lot of fresh basil for an Italian themed party and it was wonderful.
This is delicious hummus and so easy to make.
I found this hummus to be a bit too tangy for me. Either I disliked the raw garlic or it was too much lemon for me.
Really easy recipe to make and is delicious. Have made this a few times for parties and everyone always loves it.
